org.magnos.stat
Class StatFormat

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.stat.StatFormat

public final class StatFormat
extends java.lang.Object

The format of a database and its archives. A format must be given at the creation of a database to validate the database. If the database is invalid a.k.a. doesn't match this format then an exception is thrown. 

 A typical format for a database that tracks data over an extended period of time:
 
 StatFormat sf = new StatFormat(5); // A format that covers a year (365.25 days)
 sf.set(0, 300205L, 12);                        // one point every 5 minutes for an hour 
 sf.set(1, 3602467L, 24);               // one point every hour for a day
 sf.set(2, 43229589L, 14);              // one point every 12 hours for a week
 sf.set(3, 86459178L, 31);              // one point every day for a month
 sf.set(4, 7606876923L, 52);            // one point for every week in a year
 sf.compile();                                  // database size = 3328 bytes

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

public static final int DATABASE_HEADER_SIZE
The size of the database header in bytes. "SRRD"(4) archiveCount(4) creationTime(8)

public static final int ARCHIVE_HEADER_SIZE
The size of an archives header in bytes. interval(8), points(4), time(8), index(4)

Constructor Detail

StatFormat

public StatFormat(int archiveCount)
Instantiates a new StatFormat.

Parameters:
archiveCount - The number of archives in the database.
Method Detail

set

public void set(int index,
                long interval,
                int points)
Sets the format of the archive at the given index.

Parameters:
index - The index of the archive in the database.
interval - The interval of the archive in milliseconds.
points - The number of points in the archive.
See Also:
StatArchive

compile

public StatFormat compile()
Compiles the format if not compiled already. A compiled format cannot be modified (its archives interval and points), and if a modification is attempted an exception is thrown.

Returns:
The reference to this StatFormat.

validate

public boolean validate(org.magnos.data.Store store)
                 throws StatFormatException
Validates the contents of the store against this format. If this format is not compiled an exception is thrown immediately. If the given store does not contain valid data a StatFormatException is thrown. If the store is valid then true is returned.

Parameters:
store - The store to validate.
Returns:
True if the store is valid.
Throws:
StatFormatException - Thrown if the store format does not match this format.

write

public void write(org.magnos.data.Store store)
           throws StatFormatException
Writes the initial values of the database to the store. The archives in the database will contain points with no statistics.

Parameters:
store - The store to write the format to.
Throws:
StatFormatException - An error occurred because this format is not compiled.

getArchiveCount

public int getArchiveCount()
Returns the number of archives in this format.

Returns:
The number of archives in this format.

getArchiveInterval

public long getArchiveInterval(int index)
Returns the interval of the given archive. If this format is not compiled this may return an invalid value.

Parameters:
index - The index of the archive in the database.
Returns:
The interval of the given archive in milliseconds.
See Also:
StatArchive

getArchivePoints

public int getArchivePoints(int index)
Returns the number of points in the given archive. If this format is not compiled this may return an invalid value.

Parameters:
index - The index of the archive in the database.
Returns:
The number of points in the given archive.

getArchiveSize

public int getArchiveSize(int index)
Returns the size of an archive. If this format is not compiled this may return an invalid value.

Parameters:
index - The index of the archive in the database.
Returns:
The size of the archive in bytes.

getDatabaseSize

public int getDatabaseSize()
Returns the size of the database. If this format is not compiled this will return zero.

Returns:
The size of the database in bytes.

getArchiveHeaderOffset

protected int getArchiveHeaderOffset(int index)
Returns the offset for the header of the archive.
